intro: Piriqueta guianensis subsp. elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elongated stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
